questions:
What is the photo about?
A) Nature and landscapes
B) Daily life and people
C) Art and culture
D) Wildlife and animals

Where was the photo taken?
A) In a city park
B) At the beach
C) Alongside a railway track
D) Inside a building

What situation does the photo depict?
A) A peaceful nature scene
B) A sports event
C) Graffiti on a wall
D) A family gathering

What is the main focus of the photo?
A) A group of people
B) A piece of graffiti art
C) A building
D) A natural landscape

What is in the center of the photo?
A) A tree
B) A person
C) The word "SOUTH" in graffiti
D) A car

What is in the background of the photo?
A) A city skyline
B) Trees and vegetation
C) A beach
D) A busy street

What is in the foreground of the photo?
A) A river
B) A road
C) Railway tracks
D) A playground

What word is prominently displayed in the graffiti?
A) NORTH
B) EAST
C) WEST
D) SOUTH

What colors are mainly used in the graffiti?
A) Red and yellow
B) Blue and green
C) Black and white
D) Pink and purple

What is the condition of the area around the railway tracks?
A) Clean and well-maintained
B) Overgrown with vegetation and littered
C) Covered in snow
D) Sandy and dry

What type of art is depicted in the photo?
A) Sculpture
B) Painting
C) Graffiti
D) Digital art

A) The presence of a river
B) The presence of railway tracks and graffiti
C) The presence of animals
D) The presence of mountains

What is the state of the vegetation in the photo?
A) Lush and green
B) Sparse and dry
C) Covered in flowers
D) Snow-covered

A) A wooden fence
B) A concrete wall
C) A metal gate
D) A glass window

A) They are frequently used
B) They are abandoned
C) They are under construction
D) They are for pedestrian use

A) A personal name
B) A directional indication
C) An abstract concept
D) A famous quote

What is the dominant color of the railway tracks?
A) Blue
B) Red
C) Brown
D) Green

How does the graffiti stand out against its background?
A) Through its bright colors
B) Through its large size and contrasting colors
C) Through its intricate details

A) Wood
B) Metal
C) Plastic
D) Stone

A) One

C) Dirt and debris
D) Waterlogged
